The strangest dream I ever had was one I had as a child. In the dream, I was walking through a forest in the middle of the night. It was an eerie setting, with the darkness shrouding everything around me. Out of nowhere, I felt a tug on my arm and heard a strange voice. It whispered words in a language I could not understand. As I looked up, I saw a giant figure that had a goat-like face and antlers atop its head. It floated in the air and its eyes glowed red. I was petrified with fear and tried to run away, but the figure seemed to be hovering over me like a reaper. I woke up soon after, sweating and trembling with fear. Even though it was years ago, I still can't forget the terror that dream had instilled in me.

It was a quiet summer day. The sun was shining, birds were singing and it was quite tranquil. Anna was looking forward to the weekend as she was celebrating her birthday. She left work early to do some last-minute preparations. 

As she walked by the nearby park she noticed a group of kids playing on playground. She smiled and took a look around, recognizing some of the faces as kids at her daughter's school. It made her happy to see these kids having fun. 

A little boy then ran up to her, asking her if she was looking for his mom, she wasn’t sure how to respond, but nodded and asked him where his mother was. He quietly pointed at a woman waiting under one of the trees nearby. 

Anna smiled at the woman and walked up to her to introduce herself. As she got closer she noticed the woman was wearing an old wedding dress. Anna wasn't sure how to react and decided to keep the conversation to a polite goodbye and casually return home. 

What seemed like a pleasant stroll through the park was actually quite creepy. The woman in the wedding dress was not the mother of the boy but his widow, mourning the death of her son who had died in an accident two years earlier.

John was a very quiet man, not because he had nothing to say, but because he could not speak. He never wanted to talk and was content with the occasional "hello" when he ran into someone he knew.

John was also introverted and liked to stick to himself. He enjoyed long walks in nature, being alone with his thoughts, and exploring different places he stumbled upon. John found solace in his own company and enjoyed listening to the birds near his home.

Despite his lack of ability to communicate with others, John had many friends who respected him for who he was. They never made John feel uncomfortable for not being able to talk, and while they often wished John could communicate with them, they nevertheless found him a joy to be around.

John was also fond of animals, and had many cats that he looked after. He was often seen talking to them, playing with them, and caring for them, which showed his true personality and how he really felt inside.

John may not be able to communicate with others in the usual way, but he always found ways to express himself through his art, music, and animals. He was a content, gentle soul, and though it may not have been the life he wanted to lead, it was certainly the life he was living and he made the most of it.

Ellen was a young woman in her early twenties with a heart of gold. She always looked out for those less fortunate than her, and was always willing to lend a helping hand.

One day, Ellen received news that her grandmother was very ill and had not much time left. With a heavy heart, she set off for the long journey home, to say goodbye to her grandmother one last time.

When she arrived, the hospital was filled with sadness. It was obvious that Grandma was very close to the end. Ellen sat by her grandmother's bedside, holding her hand and telling her how much she loved her.

Though Grandma had no energy to speak, she returned the love with the squeeze of a hand and through her tear-filled eyes.

Ellen spent every day for a week by Grandma's side until one day, Grandma's breathing slowed until it stopped entirely. Grandma had passed away. 

Ellen held her grandmother's hand and broke down in tears, her heart broken and filled with the most intense sadness, a pain she couldn't explain.

Ellen stayed in the hospital for several hours and when she finally left, she knew that she would never get to hear the sound of Grandma's voice or laughter again and she knew that her life would never be the same.

No matter where she went in life, Ellen would carry with her the memory of her grandmother's love and kindness, and often find her eyes filling with tears whenever she thought of her.

I felt fear pulse through my veins as I heard footsteps coming up the stairs. I knew what was coming. There was no escape. All I could do was wait and hope that I'd somehow make it out alive.

But soon enough, the door opened and a figure stepped in. I vaguely recognized him from my previous work, but was certain that now, he was here for me. He had a gun in his hand, aimed at me.

"This is for all the times I've read your words and been insulted," he said coldly.

My heart raced as I realized that he was here to make me pay for my writing. He pointed the gun at me and pulled the trigger. The last thing I remember was a loud noise and my body collapsing to the ground.

My nine-year-old Labrador, Archie, was like family. He brought joy to our home and filled us all with love and laughter. But one day, the unthinkable happened - Archie was diagnosed with congestive heart failure. My beloved pup had only months left to live. We took him to the vet and did everything we could to make his passing comfortable. In the end, Archie hung on for nine months filled with cuddles, walks, and belly rubs. But his time with us was coming to an end. After much consideration, we made the difficult decision to put him to sleep. We held him in our arms as he drifted off peacefully and surrounded him with love until the very end. After nine wonderful, heartbreaking months, we said our last goodbyes. We miss him more than words can say, but we are grateful to have had such an amazing companion for so long.

My family and I had been planning our trip to Korea for months and it finally came time to go. We were all so excited, but a bit apprehensive as well. We had only seen pictures and read stories about the culture, but now we were about to experience it firsthand. When we arrived at the airport in Korea, I couldn't believe my eyes. All the hustle and bustle of the airport and the way people greeted us with such kind words and sweet smiles made it feel like we had arrived in a brand new place. 

Throughout our trip, we discovered different and exciting foods, explored the vibrant nightlife, and toured some of the cultural sites in the area. I was enthralled by everything around me, and my family and I had some of the best conversations during our time there. We learned about ways of life different from our own, and how our values as people might be interconnected despite our cultural differences. We were able to bridge the gap between the United States and Korea. 

The best part of our trip was the time we spent together as a family. We talked about the things that we loved to do back home, shared stories, and made jokes. It was more than just a vacation, it was an opportunity to get to know each other and grow even closer. It was also a chance for my parents to connect to their roots and discover the place where they were born. 

My trip to Korea was a once in a lifetime experience that I will always treasure. I left Korea with my head held high, proud of the memories I had made and the culture I had come to appreciate. It was the best vacation I had ever had.

For our 10th anniversary, my husband and I decided to visit Punta Cana for a much needed vacation. I was particularly excited for this trip - it would be my first time snorkeling! We heard rumors of recent news stories about the area but, despite our concerns, we chose to go out on the water anyway. The views were breathtaking and the experience unforgettable! We both made it back to shore safely and had a wonderful time in paradise.

Jack had been feeling down lately, so when his friends started sending him mysterious texts, he was intrigued. Little did he know, his friends and family were planning a surprise birthday party for him. 

Despite being exhausted from a long day of work, Jack couldn't help but let a smile spread across his face at the thought of a surprise. He arrived at the venue to find all his friends and family gathered around, each one holding a brightly wrapped present in hand. 

Jack was overwhelmed with emotion, and he could tell how much time and effort his loved ones had put in to make the day special. Everyone gorged on home-made cake and snacks, played lively games, laughed, and danced. It was an evening filled with warmth and love and Jack truly cherished it. 

At the end of a wonderful evening, Jack thanked all his friends and family for planning such an unforgettable birthday for him. He knew that it was the best birthday party he'd ever had.

Sam was a person with a disability and he was going about his day like he always did. He was at the park enjoying the sunshine and some fresh air when all of a sudden he felt the presence of some unsavory characters behind him. Before he knew it, they were calling him names and making fun of him for his disability. Sam felt humiliated and scared. He wanted to run, but he was too afraid.

Thankfully, some people nearby saw what was happening and intervened. They put a stop to it and then reached out to Sam to make sure he was okay. Sam was so relieved that he had someone there who cared enough to help him.

Unfortunately, stories like Sam's are far too common. Too many people with disabilities are still harassed and abused in public spaces. It's a heartbreaking injustice that needs to be addressed—everyone should be able to feel safe when out in public. People who exhibit this type of cruelty and intolerance need to be held accountable for their actions. We must stand together and make it clear that this kind of behavior will not be tolerated.

The Healthy Start scheme is an initiative from the UK government that offers free healthy food to pregnant women, breastfeeding mothers, and children under the age of 4 who meet the eligibility criteria. To be eligible for the scheme, you must be:

- Receiving certain benefits, such as Income Support, income-based Jobseeker’s Allowance, or Universal Credit

- Have an NHS Professionals registration number

- Aged 18 or over.

If you are eligible, you will receive vouchers for milk, fruit and vegetables, as well as infant formula milk, vitamins, and Healthy Start foods. You can find out more information about the Healthy Start scheme and how to apply on the Government website.
